intro: Koeleria tokiensis subsp. mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian Koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ecological significance, it is often found in natural grassland ecosystems.
